adr_address: 11 Quai Jules Courmont, 69002 Lyon, France

editorial_summary.overview: Chic quarters in a plush hotel offering river views, plus a restaurant, a bar & free Wi-Fi.

name: Boscolo Lyon Hotel & Spa

reviews.text: The rooms are a bit kitsch but very clean and beautiful, and the location is truly amazing. However, while the hotel presents itself as 5 stars, it doesn’t quite deliver. The spa is tiny and not very clean, and during our stay the fire alarm went off at midnight, forcing everyone outside. Only after asking did we receive breakfast as a gesture. Breakfast itself was delicious, but the service was lacking — most tables were left dirty and not ready for guests. Overall, the hotel has great potential and could be something special, but the staff and service still have a long way to go.

We truly enjoyed our stay at Boscolo Lyon Hotel & Spa. From the moment we arrived, the reception team and doormen were incredibly welcoming and friendly, which set a great tone for our visit. The room was beautiful and well-appointed, with a bed that was exceptionally comfortable. perfect for relaxing after a long day exploring Lyon.

Room service was another highlight: fast, efficient, and always delivered with a smile. Everything ran smoothly… except for one issue we encountered with the laundry service, which didn’t meet the same high standards as the rest of the hotel.

Overall, we had a wonderful experience and would definitely recommend Boscolo Lyon for a luxurious and relaxing stay in the heart of the city.

Had a great 5D4N stay in this hotel which is located in the city centre surrounded by restaurants and shopping places. It’s very easy to walk to vieux Lyon and access the metro station.
The staff are really friendly and the place is very stylish and comfortable. The only thing is the bathroom is a bit small which I cannot hold any clothing inside. I have to step out to get dressed after bath.
I remembered there s a girl who is doing the night room service. Whenever I was in room she greeted me with her biggest smile and a small box of chocolate. If I m not here, she will leave the small box near the pillow area.
And mouhamed ( hope I didn’t spell his name wrong) he remembered from the day I checked in with my friends and helped me on the directions before I check out.
It’s all the tiny little things that makes you feel welcoming.
This is a short stay which I haven’t tried the spa this time.
Definitely will come here when visiting Lyon again.

Great location to walking distance to  shops, bars and right of the middle. Rooms clean , big and well maintained. We were in the sixth floor and was very quiet.
The front desk people were very friendly and helpful .  Restaurant Angelo inside had a delicious food . You have to try it !!  Service sensational . We really enjoyed our stayed there

Amazing time at the hotel we were there for 2D3N and I wish we could’ve stayed longer. For starters the service was amazing only downside being they were out of toast after we ordered but they apologized for it. After check in they took our bags to our rooms which the design was great having showers but no bathtub. For the room a downside was the bathroom didn’t lock. For entertainment the had cable tv and a iPad which we could order service and search the web. The downside being expensive. Since it was our anniversary they gave us complimentary champagne and macarons. Other things that were complimentary were soda water, water, and chocolate. Beds were comfy and high quality. Next was the breakfast. Breakfast was free being a mix of a buffet and a restaurant not much to say about the restaurant otherwise. The location is amazing right next to a river and the train station with many restaurants behind being a 7 minute walk. There were also many murals only a half an hour walk. Next is the spa the hotel has is NOT complimentary but the spa itself was amazing as well as there being a pool to relax in which you didn’t have to pay for. Overall great with the only downside being pricy.
